cachecontentgroup

Statistics for Integrated Cache content group resource.

Read/write properties

name<String>

Name of the cache contentgroup for which to display statistics. If you do not set this parameter, statistics are shown for all cache contentgroups.
Minimum length = 1

clearstats<String>

Clear the statsistics / counters.
Possible values = basic, full

Read only properties

groupnon304hit<Double>

Non304 hits for ContentGroup

group304hit<Double>

304 hits for ContentGroup

totcell<Double>

Number of objects in contentgroup

totmarkercell<Double>

Number of marker objects in contentgroup

timesflushed<Double>

Number of times contentgroup is flushed

totmemory<Double>

current memory usage

maxmemory<Double>

maximum memory usage limit

Operations

You can perform the following operations:

get (all)get

Some options that you can use for each operation:

  • Getting warnings in response: NITRO allows you to get warnings in an operation by specifying the "warning" query parameter as "yes". For example, to get warnings while connecting to the NetScaler appliance, the URL is as follows:
    http://<netscaler-ip-address>/nitro/v1/config/lbvserver?warning=yes

    If any, the warnings are displayed in the "X-NITRO-WARNING" header and the HTTP status code is 209.

  • Fetch statistics of the bound resources: NITRO allows you to fetch statistics of bound resources by specifying the "statbindings" query parameter as "yes". This query parameter is applicable only to get(byname) operation. For example, to get binding statistics of a given lbvserver, the URL is as follows:
    http://<netscaler-ip-address>/nitro/v1/stat/lbvserver/lbvip1?statbindings=yes

  • Authenticated access for individual NITRO operations: One of the authentication mechanisms is OneTimelogin/Basic authentication. You can use the below two headers specifying username and password and send it along with the regular nitro request.

    X-NITRO-USER:<username>
    X-NITRO-PASS:<password>

    Note: In such cases, make sure that the request header DOES not include the following:
    Cookie:NITRO_AUTH_TOKEN=<tokenvalue>

NOTE: Mandatory parameters are marked red and bold. Placeholder text is marked in green.

get (all)

URL:http://<netscaler-ip-address>/nitro/v1/stat/cachecontentgroup

Query-parameters:

args

http://<netscaler-ip-address>/nitro/v1/stat/cachecontentgroup?args=name:<String_value>,detail:<Boolean_value>,fullvalues:<Boolean_value>,ntimes:<Double_value>,logfile:<String_value>,clearstats:<String_value>

Use this query-parameter to get cachecontentgroup resources based on additional properties.

HTTP Method:GET

Request Headers:

Cookie:NITRO_AUTH_TOKEN=<tokenvalue>
Accept:application/json

Response:

HTTP Status Code on Success: 200 OK
HTTP Status Code on Failure: 4xx <string> (for general HTTP errors) or 5xx <string> (for NetScaler-specific errors). The response payload provides details of the error

Response Header:

Content-Type:application/json

Response Payload:

{ "cachecontentgroup": [ {
      "name":<String_value>,
      "group304hit":<Double_value>,
      "totmarkercell":<Double_value>,
      "timesflushed":<Double_value>,
      "totmemory":<Double_value>,
      "totcell":<Double_value>,
      "groupnon304hit":<Double_value>,
      "maxmemory":<Double_value>
}]}

get

URL:http://<netscaler-ip-address>/nitro/v1/stat/cachecontentgroup/name_value><String>

HTTP Method:GET

Request Headers:

Cookie:NITRO_AUTH_TOKEN=<tokenvalue>
Accept:application/json

Response:

HTTP Status Code on Success: 200 OK
HTTP Status Code on Failure: 4xx <string> (for general HTTP errors) or 5xx <string> (for NetScaler-specific errors). The response payload provides details of the error

Response Header:

Content-Type:application/json

Response Payload:

{ "cachecontentgroup": [ {
      "name":<String_value>,
      "group304hit":<Double_value>,
      "totmarkercell":<Double_value>,
      "timesflushed":<Double_value>,
      "totmemory":<Double_value>,
      "totcell":<Double_value>,
      "groupnon304hit":<Double_value>,
      "maxmemory":<Double_value>
}]}
